byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON and NIKOLE HANNAH-JONES

abstract: Black residents of Dallas remain deeply skeptical over community's relations with police, despite efforts by black Police Chief David O Brown to change department's history of racism and abuse; residents' attitude reflects decades of discriminatory policies that have led to entrenched segregation and inequality in city.
lead_paragraph: Though Chief David O. Brown has worked to steer his department away from a history of racism and abuse, black residents expressed a wide range of views of the police.

headline.main: Have the Dallas Police Improved? Depends on Whom You Ask
headline.print_headline: Blacks Doubt Closer Ties With Dallas Police

snippet: Though Chief David O. Brown has worked to steer his department away from a history of racism and abuse, black residents expressed a wide range of views of the police....
